**Government Tender Announcement**
**CCGS Judy LaMarsh Conversion - Drydocking**
---

**Reference Number:** PW-__MD-051-29081
** Solicitation Number:** F7044-221042/A
**Publication Date:** June 2, 2023
**Tender Closing Date:** October 26, 2023, 14:00:00

**Notice Type:** Request for Proposal
**Trade Agreements:** Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) & Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
**Procurement Method:** Competitive - Open Bidding
**Selection Criteria:** Lowest Price
**Goods and Services:** Vessels, Miscellaneous - Repair
**Region of Opportunity:** Ontario (except NCR), Quebec (except NCR), Newfoundland and Labrador, Nova Scotia

**Background:**
The Canadian Coast Guard (CCG) requires a contractor to perform a drydocking conversion and refit on the CCGS Judy LaMarsh. The vessel was built by Aker Arctic in Romania and operated as a commercial firefighting tug on the Caspian Sea. It was procured by the CCG in February 2022 and renovated in honor of Judy LaMarsh. The vessel operates in Lake Ontario and the Gulf of St. Lawrence, providing icebreaking assistance and shipping support during winter and navigation aid maintenance when the seaway is open.

**Project Scope:**
The project includes the conversion of accommodation, recreation, and work spaces, as well as the installation and integration of a Buoy Handling Crane, Miranda Davit, and Deck Machinery (Anchor-Mooring Winches). The refit work scope involves the overhaul of the Propulsion and Power Generation systems, including new Air Compressors, Sewage System Dosage Unit, Galley Equipment, and Communication and Navigation Equipment. The project also includes regulatory work, performance tests, and docking and sea trials.

**Sourcing Strategy:**
The sourcing strategy for this procurement will be limited to Canadian suppliers, as permitted by the CFTA.

**Tender Submission Requirements:**
Bidders must submit a completed Non-Disclosure Agreement (SID) to access the technical data package, including the Statement of Work. The deadline for bid submission is October 26, 2023, at 14:00:00. A virtual Bidders' Conference will be held on July 13, 2023, and optional site visits will be hosted on June 28-29, 2023.
